entry.title: Got Friends Aeroprakt A-32 Vixxen for MSFS Enters Beta
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Got Friends has moved its Aeroprakt A32 Vixxen project into beta, developed in partnership with Aeroprakt USA and Heavenbound Aviation. A bespoke scenery for 5OI8 McKnight Airport will also ship alongside the aircraft. Four variants will be included at launch: the Cruiser, Explorer, Pioneer, and Voyager, covering glass and analogue setups, standard and tundra gear. The Explorer and Voyager have bush tyres included, while the Cruiser and Pioneer use standard wheels. As for avionics, the aircraft ships with the Working Title G3X, with optional GTN units, an EFB, and the Asobo 307 autopilot. There is also an analogue pair, using classic gauges with CDI/OBS, a KAP-140, and optional PMS50 or TDS integrations. Tyre sizes also differ between variants, 15 inches standard and 17.6 inches tundra, nudging drag, shock absorption, and top speed by roughly 4 mph.Â All four variants are included in a single purchase, with pricing expected to match previous Got Friends releases. The team is targeting both MSFS 2020 and MSFS 2024, and release is expected fairly soon. For all the latest news and updates, stay tuned on Threshold! entry.title: MM Simulations Releases Frankfurt-Hahn Airport for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. MM Simulations has recently released their rendition of Frankfurt-Hahn Airport (EDFH) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024, the low-cost oriented gateway to the Rhineland. Hahn dates back to the early 1950s when it was founded by occupying French forces and taken over by the USAF a year later, where it initially hosted the 7356th Air Base Group, responsible for improving the facilities and getting it into an operational state. The USAF used the Hahn Air Base until the early 1990s, when it was handed over to Germany. The German government decided to transform the Air Base into a civil airport to alleviate the traffic at Frankfurt International Airport. Nowadays, the airport averages around 1.3 million passengers yearly, served by Ryanair or WizzAir, the two low-cost giants operating in Hahn. The Irish carrier offers seventeen fixed destinations (and fifteen seasonals), and the Hungarian sports eight destinations. As a curiosity, Frankfurt-Hahn recently filed for bankruptcy and was sold to a new investor in mid-2022, which ended up not transferring the funds. Now they have signed two preliminary contracts with two new potential buyers, one of them being no more, no less than the owner of the NÃ¼rburgring. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with handcrafted terrain elevation, updated satellite imagery, a detailed 3D terminal, an accurate ground layout, custom ground textures, and more. â Itâs available on Contrail for roughly $19.87, requiring at least 1.2 GB of free hard disk space to install. entry.title: iniBuilds Releases Svalbard Longyear Airport for MSFS24
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. iniBuilds has recently released their newest scenery creation for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024, this time heading to the arctic airport of Svalbard Longyearbyen (ENSB). Located at 78 degrees north of the equator, the airport is the northernmost with scheduled passenger service. The first airport on Svalbard was constructed during World War II by the Luftwaffe. After the war, it was taken over by the Norwegian Air Force, who started occasional postal flights. However, operations were tricky due to harsh conditions, and could only operate a few months out of the year. In the 1970s, it was decided that a new airport was needed, so a site was selected near Hotellneset, and construction began in 1973. Svalbard Airport was officially opened on September 2, 1975 with its first flight being operated by SAS. Over the years, the airport has undergone various renovations, with the most recent being an upgrade to the passenger terminal in 2007. Today, the airport serves as a vital link to mainland Norway, with flights to Oslo and Tromso being operated by both SAS and Norwegian. Additionally, there are charter flights to Moscow and Murmansk operated by Arktikugol, a Russian mining company, to serve the mining town of Barentsburg, which has a population primarily consisting of Russian nationals. iniBuildsâ rendition features high-quality textures, detailed building interiors and parallax, recreation of landside areas including the Svalbard Global Seed Vault, custom night lighting, custom static aircraft, and more. Svalbard Airport is available for purchase on the iniBuilds Store for approximately $13.35, requiring at least 2.29GB of disk space. â If you enjoy our content and want to support Threshold, consider joining us on Patreon!

entry.title: SimPixel Releases Breda International Airport for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. SimPixel has recently launched its version of Breda International Airport (EHSE) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. This general aviation aerodrome is located in North Brabant, Netherlands, and features a runway that is 2,723 feet long. Opened in 1949 as a glider field, the airfield was originally named Seppe Airfield. Powered aircraft began flying at the airport in 1969. In 2002, the original grass runway was replaced with an asphalt runway. The airfield does not accommodate aircraft with jet engines. In 2015, the airfield was rebranded from Seppe Airfield to Breda International Airport, following an announcement made in 2014. The ICAO code EHSE remained unchanged. In addition to general aviation traffic, the airfield is home to the Vliegend Museum Seppe, which showcases various aircraft on display. The aviation training company Aviation Performance Solutions is also located at the airfield. The scenery is rich with features like high-resolution textures, custom 3D models, dynamic lighting, detailed interiors, static aircraft, ground vehicles, and much more. The newly released Breda International Airport by SimPixel is now available from iniBuilds for approximately $9.39. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold! â If you enjoy our content and want to support Threshold, consider joining us on Patreon!

entry.title: VeroRoutes Releases Pilot-Controlled Lighting for MSFS 2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. VeroRoutes has released their Pilot-Controlled Lighting addon for MSFS 2024, a first for the sim, letting you key the mic to control the runway lights.Â You do this by tuning the published PCL frequency, clicking your push-to-talk three, five, or seven times within five seconds, and the lights will then spring on for 15 minutes, with low, medium, or high intensity. Coverage is broad, too. The add-on simulates pilot-activated lighting at roughly 4,500 airfields and heliports worldwide, with runway edge, centreline, threshold, and approach systems all modelled.Â By default, the field stays dark, and the package can even be driven remotely via SimConnect. You can try it with a free trial, then pick it up from the VeroRoutes website forÂ $23.20, as well as simMarket. For all the latest news and updates, stay tuned on Threshold!
